text:
I was just looking at data from deal properties and noticed there’s an associatedDealIds array, are deal to deal associations likely to become a thing or is there a beta I can join, we have a couple of use cases where this would be useful.

I’m literally creating a custom property to add the associated deal to now

Hi, I have a question about the WordPress Plugin tracking code and cookie consent. Is there any way to use the cookie consent settings from HubSpot on my WordPress page? Currently the HubSpot WordPress loads the tracking code by default without any consent. Or is it possible to disable the tracking code from the Plugin and load it with the consent plugin Borlabs Cookie?

That’s great thanks, Problem is I did a couple of projects that really could have used this 1-2 years ago! :stuck_out_tongue: I’ve got workflows upon workflows and webhooks doing things to solve for the above
Is there a way to manage these associations through the api yet?
One thing we’ve had to do a few times is add someone new to an existing deal and as far as we’re aware the only way we can do this is through the api or manually

I’m experiencing speed issues on the HubSpot CMS, since midnight
HubSpot is taking 1.5 to 2 seconds to respond
Is this a general issue?
Normally we grade A, with performance of +90%, structure of +95%, LCP <1s
Now we are down to C and even D with some websites (perf 49%, LCP 3.8s) structure remains 98%
initial server response time up to > 1.5 s
maybe also an issue with cloudflare?
<@U26BLKGE4> <@U3T21PDBK> either of you do anything like this?

Hello everyone! I’m looking for a developer to help us improve our theme and create specific modules, hopefully speaking Spanish. Any information thank you very much! Sergio from Growbetter Agency - Chile

you’d have to use serverless for sure, and likely not use standard HubSpot forms (I suppose you technically could using global form event listeners, but I would question the motivation as there’s likely a simpler solution). I’d suggest using a custom-built form and using something like Firebase, which has some built-in authentication patterns that you could use, and then the the rest of the form experience after authentication you could revert back to a HS form

Hola Sergio,
I am a HubSpot freelance developer based in Spain.
Happy to chat.
Please check my availability to find a spot that works with your agenda:
<https://meetings.HubSpot.com/gonzalotorreras/hola|https://meetings.HubSpot.com/gonzalotorreras/hola>

<@U26BLKGE4> Thank you for taking the time to reply to this, your input is much appreciated! Thank you <@U3T21PDBK> for taking a look as well and Thank you <@UD53A9UUR> for always connecting the right people to the right questions! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey all :wave: I am not sure what is the best channel for this issue so here it is in the main channel!

We are trying the customer portal to show our users their support tickets, using sso with jwt to authenticate them. However when I am redirected to my login page and provide the jwt to the redirect url, HubSpot is redirecting back to the login page. So it stays there in an invite loop. Does anyone imagine what this issue could be?
